alfredsnippet.snippet:
Sir Fred Hoyle, The big bang in astronomy, New Scientist, 19 Nov. 1981, pp.524-526

"The Universe always turns out to be incomparably more subtle than we expect ... Consider how almost every aspect of every planetary mission throws up an unanticipated surprise."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Hoyle on Unanticipated Surprises
